# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here's how you can solve this problem using the DataFrames library in Julia:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

# Function to add year-month column
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map((dt)->Dates.year(dt)*100 + Dates.month(dt), df.dt)
end
```

The `add_yearmonth` function takes a DataFrame as an input, extracts the year and month from each DateTime in the column `dt`, concatenates them together into an integer in the format "yyyymm", and adds this new column to the DataFrame. The map function applies a function element-wise across the column, converting each DateTime to an integer in the desired format.
